boat.full_description:
Lindy has been in the Beale / Burgoyne Family since 1971. She was bought by my Father from a Mr Miller of Cambridge who used to write about his cruises particularly in France with his wife which were published in Yachting Monthly under DCM Accountancy Assistant. She was originally built by David Hillyard for an Irishman and was called Graineog in 1924, by 1929 she was back with David Hillyard and was owned by a couple of people. In 1945 she was purchased by Vice Admiral Sir Lancelot Bell Davis KBE, who sailed her on the South Coast with his wife until 1950 when she was sold again as he took on his fathers yacht the Marjorie.

Since she has been in the family we have cruised throughout Holland and Germany particularly with Friesian Islands, she visited London and went all the way to Twickenham having lowered the mast at St Katherines. Since 1991 her cruising exploits have not been so great just the local rivers in Essex as the family have a 9 ton Hillyard, which is slightly bigger for cruising!!.

She raced in the Old Gaffers races in the 70/80's winning a number of trophies, and also participated in the Heineken Rally in 1974, appearing in Motor Boat and Yachting.

She has had new decks fitted as well as a new engine.  But apart from some alterations below deck to allow for family holidays ie the removal of a wardrobe! she is very much original.
boat.name: Lindy
boat.short_description: Lindy was built by David Hillyard in 1924 and is known as a 5 ton Hillyard.
